Returns A NULL-terminated string carrying the server name, or NULL if none was provided.

Obtain the server name offered by a client or server during connection establishmet. This is the value commonly carried in the TLS SNI extesion.

Function# sec_protocol_metadata_get_server_name(_:)

iOS 12.0–18.5DeprecatediPadOS 12.0–18.5DeprecatedMac Catalyst 13.1–18.5DeprecatedmacOS 10.14–15.5DeprecatedtvOS 12.0–18.5DeprecatedvisionOS 1.0–2.5DeprecatedwatchOS 5.0–11.5Deprecated

```
func sec_protocol_metadata_get_server_name(_ metadata: sec_protocol_metadata_t) -> UnsafePointer<CChar>?
```

## [ Parameters ](/documentation/Security/sec_protocol_metadata_get_server_name(_:)#parameters)

`metadata`A `sec_protocol_metadata_t` instance.

## [Return Value](/documentation/Security/sec_protocol_metadata_get_server_name(_:)#return-value)

Returns A NULL-terminated string carrying the server name, or NULL if none was provided.

## [Discussion](/documentation/Security/sec_protocol_metadata_get_server_name(_:)#discussion)

Obtain the server name offered by a client or server during connection establishmet. This is the value commonly carried in the TLS SNI extesion.
